He is considered the voice of the “middle market” CFO and one of the industry's most prominent business, career and life 'Connectors.’ Recently named one of the Philadelphia region's '40 Under 40,' Nick has spent over 15 years cultivating and educating his ever-growing professional network.  Before launching AchieveNext and The CFO Alliance, Nick served in a leadership role for a national firm helping companies work through issues and connecting them to other finance executives. Prior to that, Nick established and led a human capital firm. Nick began his career as a practicing attorney.

Nick has a Bachelor of Business Administration degree, with a concentration in Finance, from Loyola College in Maryland. He earned his law degree from Widener University School of Law and lives outside of Philadelphia with his wife and three children.

Greg has led organizations through transformation processes, critical business issues, and their implications for human capital during his 15 plus years of experience in human resources, operations, technology tools, communications, and team management.

Greg is a results-driven leader with global experience in developing and managing the strategic direction of various functions for multiple business categories – from start-up to large scale, managing full-cycle projects with a watchful eye on top and bottom line performance.

He previously served as Practice Leader for a national firm’s business and strategy division. Greg provided strategic and operational leadership for the firm's business consulting solutions offerings, focused on maximizing ROI for each client's people, processes, and technologies. Greg has a dual BA from Cornell University in Business and Biology and now currently lives outside of Philadelphia with his wife and three children.

founders.bio: Mr. Peter Williams co-founded Annapolis in 2006. For the 12 years prior, Peter served in executive management positions in, and as a director of, numerous public and private oil and gas companies. Most recently, Peter was the CEO and Chairman of two successful private oil and gas companies, Krang Energy Inc. and Passage Energy Inc. Peter also had a term as a governor of the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers (CAPP) between 2003 and 2005. Prior to that, Peter served as Senior Vice President and COO of Stampeder Exploration Ltd., a public company listed on both the TSX and NYSE. Peter has been a director of a number of other oil and gas start-ups, namely Avalanche Energy Limited, Ice Energy Limited, Glacier Energy Limited, Berland Exploration Ltd., Greenbank Energy Ltd., Breton Energy Inc., Corinthian Energy Corp., Caltex Energy Inc., Bulldog Oil & Gas Inc. and Evolve Exploration Ltd. Peter is currently a director of Highrock Energy Ltd., Corinthian Exploration Corp., Hawk Exploration Ltd., Caltex Resources Ltd., Painted Pony Petroleum Ltd. and Venturion Oil Limited, sitting as Chairman of Corinthian. Prior to entering the oil and gas industry, Peter practiced law at Bennett Jones for 11 years. Peter earned a B.A. (economics) in 1977 and an LL.B. in 1981, both from Dalhousie University.

Peter Williams is responsible for providing strategic direction and overseeing the growth of the business.

Peter was named to the 2013 Investment News Power 20 – the 20 individuals around the globe expected to have the greatest impact on the financial advisor community in the coming year. Peter has been a guest speaker on private capital markets and entrepreneurship at numerous events, and is a member of the Milken Institute Young Leaders Circle.

In 2011 Peter, as Principal, formed Legumex Walker Inc.,a growth-oriented processor and merchandiser of special crops, pulses and canola products, through the merger of three agriculture processing companies. The company is one of the largest processors of special crops and pulses in Canada and completed a $70 million IPO on the TSX (Ticker: LWP) in July of 2011. Peter remains a member of the company’s Board of Directors.

Peter started ACE Portal after a successful career in investment banking with CIBC World Markets, Oppenheimer and Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, and Credit Suisse First Boston. In his banking career, Peter successfully raised over $13 billion in capital for a diverse group of companies, across multiple industries, through high yield and investment grade debt and equity issues. In addition, he has acted as an advisor on numerous M&A transactions with an aggregate value of over $3 billion.

Peter has a BSc in Mechanical Engineering from Queen’s University in Kingston, Ontario and an MBA from the Richard Ivey School of Business at the University of Western Ontario.

investors.bio:
Brendan was the co-Founder/CEO of Identified.com, a data and analytics platform that was acquired by Workday in March 2014. Identified developed and patented its proprietary SYMAN technology, a data normalization engine that processed and organized large amounts of social media data to make it useful to companies for recruiting and marketing. Identified raised $30 million from leading Sillicon Valley investors and VCs like Tim Draper, Bill Draper, Joel Peterson, Eric Schmidt's Innovation Endeavors, VantagePoint Capital Partners and Capricorn. Brendan also helped found Cabify, an on-demand car service operating in Spanish-speaking countries in Latin America.

Brendan graduated from Stanford University's MBA program and Princeton University. Brendan previously worked at Goldman Sachs & Co. and The Blackstone Group.

As VP for New Ventures at Northeastern University, I lead a cross-functional team to incubate new business ideas, diversify revenue streams, and advance a new model of higher education. They are currently piloting three new ventures: Learnx (www.learnx.co), Experiential Network (www.experientialnetwork.org), and Level (www.leveledu.com).

I'm a Techstars mentor and angel investor in Able, Cratejoy, Crayon, Dunwello, Experiment Engine, Greycork, Konekt, Libboo, Nimble, Owl Investments, Panorama Education and TrueLens.

Previously, as VP for Content & Operations at Boundless, I led the content team where I hired, trained and managed six direct reports and 300+ SMEs to grow their content coverage 7X from three subjects to 21 while at the same time reducing their production costs by 67%. I also managed their HR and legal functions, and led their affiliate and field marketing teams. I developed key relationships with Apple and Amazon and helped successfully settle a lawsuit with Pearson and other publishers. During my time at Boundless, they increased their monthly usage to over 3 million students and educators. Boundless was acquired by Valore in 2015.

I co-founded Infochimps and led the company as its initial CEO, raising venture capital and growing the team and business during the company's formative years. While CEO, I led the acquisitions of Data Marketplace (YC W10) and Keepstream (Capital Factory 2010), and negotiated and closed numerous data partnerships, including with Microsoft, Amazon, and Foursquare. Infochimps was acquired by CSC (NYSE:CSC) in 2013.

After graduating from The University of Texas School of Law with Honors, I was a corporate and securities attorney at a leading international law firm, working with startups and VC funds in company formation, debt and equity financings, M&A, and public offerings. I represented companies and investors in over 25 financings raising an aggregate of over $250 million. I'm licensed to practice law in MA and TX.

Will Davis is a co-founder of Outbox, a system for digitizing postal mail.

Once known as a problem child for his disruptive behavior, Will is now passionate about solving big problems through disruptive innovation. He enjoys developing partnerships and making strategy a reality for Outbox. Will found meaning in public service on Capitol Hill, discovered his passion for business through real estate development, and learned ways to combine them while attending Harvard Business School.

Evan Baehr is a co-founder of Outbox, a system for digitizing postal mail.

A fan of wax seals and handwritten thank you notes, Evan is passionate about changing how we communicate with each other where the digital and physical meet. From fundraising to hiring, Evan sells the vision of Outbox wherever he goes. Previously he worked on the Facebook platform and for Paypal founder Peter Thiel, served in the White House and U.S. House of Representatives, and graduated from Princeton, Yale, and Harvard Business School.

Jason Seriff is the CTO and a co-founder of Outbox, a system for digitizing postal mail.

Always looking for ways to make life more efficient and comfortable, Jason loves building everything from high volume transaction processing systems to patio furniture in his woodworking shop. As CTO, he focuses on building the right product at the right time, and making sure it all works without friction. A Georgia Tech grad in human computer interaction, Jason later developed a passion for technical leadership while at Oracle, Austin Logistics and Netspend.

investors.bio:
A co-Founder of Seeq, Jon began his career as a process engineer and software developer for process industries. Prior to Seeq, Jon spent 21 years at OSIsoft where he held leadership roles as VP of Engineering and VP of Marketing. 

Jon earned his bachelor degree in Chemical Engineering at Northwestern University. 

The curriculum involved writing computer programs to solve engineering problems, which sparked his interest in software and a goal to engage in the software industry. 

Jon spent the 10 years following graduation working in the process industries. As a process engineer he worked in a wide range of areas including asset optimization, energy management, advanced control and process equipment design. Software and programming were used extensively to address challenges. In 1992 Jon joined OSIsoft, then called Oil Systems, Inc., as a software developer. OSIsoft offered a unique opportunity to become a professional software developer building products for the process industries.

At OSIsoft Jon initially wrote connectors between control systems and OSIsoft’s real-time data management product called the PI System. Jon joined a small team to create the next generation real-time data management system—PI Server 3.0. Jon was instrumental in the architecture, design and coding of the PI Server. The PI Server is recognized as the industry standard and has nearly 15,000 installations worldwide.

Jon also held leadership roles of VP Engineering and VP Marketing at OSIsoft. During Jon’s tenure as engineering lead OSIsoft saw fast growth in customers as well as in the product line. Two notable accomplishments during this time was High Availability functionality added across the entire product suite and the creation of Managed PI—an automated service that assures optimal operation of OSIsoft products. Jon became Marketing VP for OSIsoft in 2008 this role involved many responsibilities including production of OSIsoft’s very popular Users’ Conferences.

Jon, his wife Meg and son Samuel live in Larkspur, CA. They all love outdoor activities such as biking, hiking and paddling on San Francisco Bay, mountain lakes and rivers.

founders.bio: Ken has 22 years of technology experience. He quickly synergizes diverse technical and market data into new, useful products and patents. Ken used this unique ability to start four companies, sell one company’s IP to Digimarc, become VP of Technology of a hardware startup, develop real-time software as early as 1987, and create 78 issued patents and 152 published applications worldwide. During his five years at Digimarc, Ken helped create a global licensing program, positively affected many standards for Digimarc, led an international team with Philips, and developed a secure ID architecture that became part of a US law. Ken has BS, MS, MSEE, and PhD degrees, finishing his PhD in less than three years with 13 publications and a 4.0 GPA. In summary, Ken is intrigued by new technology, emerging markets and people’s behavior, and uses his creativity to turn this passion into revenue-generating technology.

Neil has over 20 years of experience managing complex engineering projects and bringing new products to market. He has supervised and developed a range of software products from free applications to multi-million dollar systems. Extensive experience working in new startup environments has made Neil capable of wearing many hats and contributing in all areas critical to a young company’s success. Before 4-Tell, he was a partner in a GIS mapping company and served as VP of Engineering for six years, helping to grow the company from an unfunded startup to a profitable business. During that time he also helped form, spin-off, and sell a hardware division of the company. Neil has BS and MS degrees in Electrical and Computer Engineering from The Johns Hopkins University. He was a founding board member of the Digital Watermarking Alliance. He currently holds 19 US patents with 43 published applications pending.

Zewei is a graduate of the Law School of Beihang University.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Anthony Masso is an executive advisor to Water Street, a strategic private equity firm focused exclusively on the healthcare industry.Anthony has extensive experience in healthcare having worked for several managed care organizations, as well as venture-based startups and consulting firms. 

He has served on the boards of more than 15 companies ranging from managed care organizations, physician partnerships, public service and venture capital companies. Anthony previously served as president and CEO of Consortium Health Plans, president of StrongCastle, LLC, president of Litho Group, Inc., executive vice president of Integrated Health Services, Inc.

Anthony received his master’s in public administration from Syracuse University and his bachelor of science degree from the University of Rhode Island.

Ned Villers is a partner with Water Street, a strategic private equity firm focused exclusively on the healthcare industry. Ned has been investing in the healthcare industry since 1999. 

He has spent the majority of his private equity career with Water Street and its predecessor organizations, beginning with First Chicago Equity Capital and then serving as a vice president at One Equity Partners. 

After briefly working as a vice president at Summit Partners, Ned rejoined the team to found Water Street in 2005. During his career, Ned has invested in a broad range of companies across the healthcare industry, most recently building a leading group of companies for Water Street in outsourced healthcare services. 

Ned currently serves on the boards of directors of Access MediQuip, CareCentrix, HealthPlan Holdings and New Century Health. He received a bachelor's degree in public policy studies from Duke University and his master’s degree in business administration from Northwestern's Kellogg School of Management.

Steve is an operating partner with Water Street, a strategic private equity firm focused exclusively on the healthcare industry, with more than 16 years of senior management experience in key healthcare segments, including specialty pharmacy, specialty distribution, and outsourced payer and pharmaceutical services. 

Prior to Water Street, Steve was president and CEO of Priority Healthcare. Among his many accomplishments, he helped lead the company’s successful initial public offering from its former parent, Bindley Western Industries, where he served as senior vice president. 

Steve also held executive positions with CoreSource, one of the nation’s largest third-party administrators of employee health benefits. Prior to focusing on the healthcare industry, Steve achieved a distinguished management career at IBM Corporation.

 He currently serves as director of Access MediQuip, CareCentrix, Claymore Securities, HealthPlan Holdings, New Century Health and SXC Health Solutions. Steve received a bachelor’s degree in Industrial Management from Purdue University.

A highly regarded leader in the health care industry, Steve is the former CEO of Magellan Health Services, Inc. (NASDAQ: MGLN), where he spearheaded the company’s successful turnaround and restructuring out of bankruptcy, and diversification into the nation’s foremost specialty health care management company. 

He also led Prudential Healthcare through its major turnaround while serving as the company’s chairman, president and CEO, culminating in the company’s successful sale to Aetna. Steve is the co-founder of Value Health, Inc., a NYSE managed care company specializing in behavioral health and prescription drug benefits. 

He also founded Internet HealthCare Group, an early stage health and technology venture fund. Previously, he held leadership roles at CIGNA and Kaiser Permanente. Steve currently serves as the chairman of Access MediQuip and CareCentrix, and as director of Digital Insurance, HealthMarkets and HealthPlan Holdings. He received his bachelor’s degree in economics and master’s degree in health services administration from the State University of New York at Stony Brook.

Dr. Richard A. Chaifetz is the Founder and Chairman of Chaifetz Group. He founded ComPsych Corporation in 1984. As Chairman and CEO of ComPsych he has grown the company to be the world’s largest provider of employee assistance programs (EAP) and the leading provider of fully integrated EAP, behavioral health, work-life, wellness and outsourced HR solutions. ComPsych provides services to over 55 million individuals and 20,000 organizations throughout the U.S. and 120 countries. Dr. Chaifetz is the most frequently quoted expert in the behavioral health/workplace field, appearing regularly in The Wall Street Journal, USA Today, Newsweek, BusinessWeek and Time. He also appears frequently on numerous radio and television programs as an expert on trends in the workplace, psychological effects of world events and the impact of economic trends on the work environment.

Named to Crain’s Chicago Business Who’s Who list every year from 2004, Dr. Chaifetz is a member of the American Psychological Association, The Economic Club of Chicago and The Executives’ Club of Chicago. In addition, he has served on the board of directors of several public and private corporations which currently include Access MediQuip and Edgewater Funds, and non-profit organizations such as The Field Museum of Natural History, the Miami University Farmer School of Business, Saint Louis University Board of Trustees and TCS Education System. In 2007, he was named Saint Louis University's Entrepreneurial Alumni of the Year and was inducted into the University's Entrepreneurial Hall of Fame.

Dr. Chaifetz, a licensed neuropsychologist, is a magna cum laude graduate of Saint Louis University and received his Psy.D. from the Illinois School of Professional Psychology.

founders.bio:
Levi Rosenblum is the founder, innovator, and driving force behind 1st Merchant Funding, the South Florida-based, technology focused specialty finance company that provides working capital to thousands of merchants throughout the United States.

Founded in 2007 under Mr. Rosenblum’s direction, 1st Merchant Funding pioneered the industry’s leading noncredit-based funding program, known as the “Starter” advance, which funds high risk merchants with immediate working capital. Profitable since day one, 1st Merchant Funding has evolved into one of the nation’s fastest growing companies.  In 2011, the company earned a spot on the Inc. 500 list, ranking among the 100 fastest growing companies in the nation, and in 2012 1st Merchant Funding was once again selected for inclusion on the Inc. 500 list.

Mr. Rosenblum’s sterling reputation in the industry is founded on 1st Merchant Funding’s three core accomplishments: first, fostering one of the largest networks of independent sales offices in the US; second, generating merchant cash advances at industry leading volumes; and third and most important, developing PowerForce®  –  the industry leading proprietary technology platform that markets, originates, funds, manages, and collects merchant cash advances by working with merchants, agents, banks, and processors across one transparent platform. Mr. Rosenblum previously owned and operated one of the largest “online storefront and shopping cart” development businesses in the United States.

He currently resides in Bal Harbor, Florida with his wife and three children, and is an active member of several local charitable organizations.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Antoine is a serial entrepreneur currently serving as the founder, President and CEO of Solantro, an Ottawa based fabless semiconductor company delivering next generation semiconductor based solutions for distributed power generation solutions. 

He is also a partner at Rho, a diversified private equity firm based in New York, Montreal and Palo Alto, CA.

For more than 20 years, he has defined and shaped the direction of several notable and groundbreaking technology firms, including Axiom Microdevices Inc. (sold to Skyworks NASDAQ: SWKS), Philsar Semiconductor Inc. (sold to Skyworks Solutions – NASDAQ: SWKS) and Skystone Systems Inc. (sold to Cisco Systems – NASDAQ: CSCO).

Mr. Paquin serves as a director on the board of Accedian Networks. 

Prior to that point, Mr. Paquin served on a number of prominent public and private company boards, including GMP Capital, one of Canada’s premier investment banks, and Public Mobile, one of Canada’s new Cellular Operators.

Antoine has received several awards during his entrepreneurial career, including Entrepreneur of the Year for the Nation's Capital, recipient of the National Research Council's Innovator of the Year Award, and recipient of the IWAY awards for exceptional entrepreneurial achievements (Canada's Information Highway Initiative).

Antoine was born in Montréal, Canada and raised in Canada, France and Africa.

George Riedel was previously responsible for leading Nortel's corporate strategy including mergers and acquisitions as part of the Company's restructuring activities.

Prior to joining Nortel, Riedel was vice president, strategy and corporate development for Juniper Networks, leading corporate strategy, business development and mergers and acquisitions. His previous career experience includes 15 years at the management consulting firm of McKinsey and Company, where he co-led telecom and high-tech practices in North America and Asia. He has also served as an engineering manager at Exxon Co. USA. In addition to Accedian Networks, Riedel also sits on the board of Chromatic Systems.

Reidel holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering with distinction from the University of Virginia. He is based in Boston.

founders.bio:
Patrick Ostiguy founded Accedian Networks in 2004 and serves as president, chief executive officer and sits on the board of directors. With over a decade of pertinent telecom industry experience, Patrick is responsible for filing of several Patent Applications and has published dozens of industry conference proceedings and technology articles.

Prior to founding Accedian, Patrick was co-founder Avantas Networks and launched the industry's first portable Ethernet and SONET field-services test-set. Avantas Networks was acquired for $100M by EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering and Patrick continued his role in product management and participated in several M&A activities at the executive level. Prior to Avantas, Patrick was part of the initial Positron Fiber Systems (PFS) team that commercialized the industry's first Ethernet over SONET Multi-Service Provisioning Platform (MSPP). PFS was acquired by Reltec in 1997 for $200M, and subsequently by Marconi.

Patrick is the recipient of the Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year award in Quebec for recognition of his technology solutions, his exceptional leadership in driving growth, development and innovation in the industry.

Patrick holds a Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering from University of Sherbrooke.

Steven Cole is the Director of Product. In his role, Steven works with Social Solutions’ team members and leadership to create, communicate and execute Social Solutions’ product vision and strategy. Steven joined Social Solutions in early 2013. He brings to this position, not only a passion for creating great products, but also ensuring the right products are being built. 

Prior to joining Social Solutions, Steven held various software development and management positions, including most recently serving as the Director of Software Engineering at Eyemaginations. Steven also spent time working on test software for the U.S. Army at Jacobs Engineering and developing video games and simulations at BreakAway Games. investors.bio:
Sergey Brin, a native of Moscow, received a bachelor of science degree with honors in mathematics and computer science from the University of Maryland at College Park. He is currently on leave from the Ph.D. program in computer science at Stanford University, where he received his master's degree. Sergey is a recipient of a National Science Foundation Graduate Fellowship as well as an honorary MBA from Instituto de Empresa. At Stanford, he met Larry Page and worked on the project that became [Google](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/google). Together they founded Google Inc. in 1998, and Sergey continues to share responsibility for day-to-day operations with Larry Page and Eric Schmidt.

Sergey's research interests include search engines, information extraction from unstructured sources, and data mining of large text collections and scientific data. He has published more than a dozen academic papers, including Extracting Patterns and Relations from the World Wide Web; Dynamic Data Mining: A New Architecture for Data with High Dimensionality, which he published with Larry Page; Scalable Techniques for Mining Casual Structures; Dynamic Itemset Counting and Implication Rules for Market Basket Data; and Beyond Market Baskets: Generalizing Association Rules to Correlations.

Sergey has been a featured speaker at several international academic, business and technology forums, including the World Economic Forum and the Technology, Entertainment and Design Conference. He has shared his views on the technology industry and the future of search on the Charlie Rose Show, CNBC, and CNNfn. In 2004, he and Larry Page were named "Persons of the Week" by ABC World News Tonight.

Source: [Google.com](http://www.google.com/corporate/execs.html)

Anne co-founded 23andMe in 2006 after a decade spent in healthcare investing, focused primarily on biotechnology companies. Her hope was to empower consumers with access to their own genetic information and to create a way to generate more personalized information so that commercial and academic researchers could better understand and develop new drugs and diagnostics. 

Presently, 23andMe has built one of the world’s largest databases of individual genetic information. Its novel, web-based research approach allows for the rapid recruitment of participants to many genome-wide association studies at once, reducing the time and money needed to make new discoveries, and the company has created a proven and standardized resource for finding new genetic association and confirming genetic loci discovered by others. 

Under Anne’s leadership 23andMe has made significant advances in bringing personalized medicine directly to the public. Anne graduated from Yale University with a BS in Biology. Getting access to and understanding her own genetic information had always been one of her ambitions.

Yuri started investing in Internet companies in 1999. In 2005, he founded Digital Sky Technologies, Limited (now DST Global/Mail.ru Group) to focus on Internet investments in the Russian speaking world. 

Under his leadership, Mail.ru Group performed approximately 75 transactions and built what is now the leading Russian language website in terms of users. Mail.ru Group is also the seventh most popular website globally in terms of page views or minutes spent online according to Comscore. Yuri is now the non-executive Chairman of Mail.ru Group.

In mid-2009, Yuri launched DST Global as the primary vehicle for international Internet investments. Under his leadership, [DST Global](/company/dst-global) invested in [Facebook](/company/facebook), the world's largest social network, in [Zynga](/company/zynga), a leading social gaming company and in [Groupon](/company/groupon), a leading social e-commerce company.

Yuri graduated from Moscow State University in 1985 with an advanced degree in theoretical physics and subsequently conducted research at the Institute of Physics in the Russian Academy of Sciences between 1985 and 1989. He attended the Wharton Business School MBA program between 1990 and 1992.

Sergey Brin, a native of Moscow, received a bachelor of science degree with honors in mathematics and computer science from the University of Maryland at College Park. He is currently on leave from the Ph.D. program in computer science at Stanford University, where he received his master's degree. Sergey is a recipient of a National Science Foundation Graduate Fellowship as well as an honorary MBA from Instituto de Empresa. At Stanford, he met Larry Page and worked on the project that became [Google](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/google). Together they founded Google Inc. in 1998, and Sergey continues to share responsibility for day-to-day operations with Larry Page and Eric Schmidt.

Sergey's research interests include search engines, information extraction from unstructured sources, and data mining of large text collections and scientific data. He has published more than a dozen academic papers, including Extracting Patterns and Relations from the World Wide Web; Dynamic Data Mining: A New Architecture for Data with High Dimensionality, which he published with Larry Page; Scalable Techniques for Mining Casual Structures; Dynamic Itemset Counting and Implication Rules for Market Basket Data; and Beyond Market Baskets: Generalizing Association Rules to Correlations.

Sergey has been a featured speaker at several international academic, business and technology forums, including the World Economic Forum and the Technology, Entertainment and Design Conference. He has shared his views on the technology industry and the future of search on the Charlie Rose Show, CNBC, and CNNfn. In 2004, he and Larry Page were named "Persons of the Week" by ABC World News Tonight.

Source: [Google.com](http://www.google.com/corporate/execs.html)

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Bill founded Google Ventures in 2009 and oversees all of the fund’s global activities. GV is one of the most active investors in the world, with approximately $1.5 billion under management, 250 portfolio companies and offices in Mountain View, San Francisco, Boston, New York, and London. The fund’s early track record includes investments in pioneers like Uber, Nest, DocuSign, and Cloudera; IPOs like Foundation Medicine and RetailMeNot; and exits to industry leaders like Facebook, Twitter, and Yahoo.

In every sector from life sciences to transportation, exponential increases in computing capacity are opening doors for advances difficult to comprehend today. The most exciting and surprising progress will come from risk-taking startups. Bill and his team designed GV to find those startups and help them get the job done.

Bill studied neuroscience at Middlebury College and conducted neurobiology research at Duke University. He founded and sold web-hosting pioneer Burlee.com,  and was instrumental in the formation of Google’s Calico project.

Fast Company named Bill one of the most creative people in business, Vanity Fair named him one to watch and to the New Establishment list, and he’s been named one of Silicon Valley’s 40 under 40.

Bill is responsible for all of GV’s activities as well as Google’s global startup efforts, including Google for Entrepreneurs, Campus London, and Campus Tel Aviv. He has a particular interest in next generation life sciences and artificial intelligence.

Esther Dyson is the chairman of EDventure Holdings. Her primary activity is investing in and nurturing startups with a recent focus on the healthcare, human capital, and aerospace sectors.

 
 Dyson is fascinated by new business models, technologies, and markets both economically and politically. From October 2008 to March 2009, she lived in Star City outside Moscow, Russia, training as a backup cosmonaut. Apart from that, she is also an active board member for a variety of startups. She was the founding chairman of [ICANN](http://www.crunchbase.com/organization/icann) from 1998 to 2000. In addition, she wrote the best-selling and widely translated book Release 2.0: A Design for Living in the Digital Age. Her investments include [Flickr](http://www.crunchbase.com/organization/flickr), [del.icio.us](http://www.crunchbase.com/product/del-icio-us), and [Medstory](http://www.crunchbase.com/organization/medstory).

 
 Dyson holds a bachelor’s degree in economics from Harvard University.

Serafim is an Associate Professor of Computer Science at Stanford University. His research focuses on computational methods for sequence analysis, particularly in whole-genome assembly and comparative genomics. His research group has a track record of producing widely-used tools in computational genomics of high accuracy and computational efficiency.

Patrick is a founding partner of Xfund. Prior to joining Xfund full-time, Patrick was a partner at NEA and led the firm’s consumer and seed investment practices. He is a director of 23andMe, Curalate, Euclid, MeCommerce, Philo, and Ravel Law, and is actively involved with CrowdMed, IFTTT, Rock Health, and Upworthy. Past investments include Pulse (acquired by LinkedIn), Loopt (acquired by Green Dot), GoodGuide (acquired by Underwriters Laboratories), Xfire (acquired by Viacom), and Xoom (NASDAQ: XOOM). Prior to joining NEA, Patrick helped to grow ZEFER, an Internet services firm (acquired by NEC) to more than $100 million in annual revenues and more than 700 people across six global offices. Prior to ZEFER, Patrick was with McKinsey & Company, where he specialized in hardware, software, and services companies. Patrick received a joint JD-MBA degree from Harvard Business School and Harvard Law School, where he served as an Editor of the Harvard Law Review. Patrick was a Commonwealth Scholar at Oxford University, where he earned a Master of Science degree. Patrick earned his A.B. degree at Harvard College in Environmental Science. He is a member of the New York and Massachusetts bars, an elected director of the Harvard Alumni Association, and a member of the Committee to Visit Harvard College.

Andy Page brings more than 20 years of experience to his role at Gilt Groupe. 

As Chief Financial Officer and Head of Operations, Andy oversees all of the company's financial operations, distribution, corporate strategic planning and Gilt City.

Prior to joining Gilt, Andy was COO and CFO at PlayPhone Inc., where he was GM of North America and responsible for managing the company's financial and engineering organizations across 15 countries.

 Before PlayPhone, Andy was CFO and SVP of Business Strategy at StubHub Inc., where he managed the company's financial operations, business strategy and administrative functions. 

He also led the company's sale to eBay in 2007. Andy has held senior executive positions at Panasas Inc., ONI Systems Corp. and Robertson Stephens & Company.

Andy holds a bachelor of arts from Princeton University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He is an advisor to several private e-commerce companies and serves on the board of directors of My New Red Shoes, a nonprofit organization that provides back-to-school clothes for homeless and low-income children in the San Francisco Bay Area.

founders.bio:
Linda Avey is co-founder and CEO of Curious, Inc., a personal data discovery platform. 

Previously, she co-founded 23andMe, the leading personal genetics company. Her early career focused on sales and business development roles in the biopharmaceutical industry in San Francisco, Boston, San Diego, and Washington, D.C. While at Affymetrix and Perlegen Sciences, she focused on development of translational research collaborations with academic and pharmaceutical partners. 

Linda also worked at Spotfire helping researchers maximize value from scientific data through visualization tools, and at Applied Biosystems during the early days of the human genome project. 

She holds a BA degree in biology from Augustana College.

Anne co-founded 23andMe in 2006 after a decade spent in healthcare investing, focused primarily on biotechnology companies. Her hope was to empower consumers with access to their own genetic information and to create a way to generate more personalized information so that commercial and academic researchers could better understand and develop new drugs and diagnostics. 

Presently, 23andMe has built one of the world’s largest databases of individual genetic information. Its novel, web-based research approach allows for the rapid recruitment of participants to many genome-wide association studies at once, reducing the time and money needed to make new discoveries, and the company has created a proven and standardized resource for finding new genetic association and confirming genetic loci discovered by others. 

Under Anne’s leadership 23andMe has made significant advances in bringing personalized medicine directly to the public. Anne graduated from Yale University with a BS in Biology. Getting access to and understanding her own genetic information had always been one of her ambitions.

founders.bio:
Mark Friedman founded Accruent in 1995 and established the company as the leading provider of real estate and facilities management solutions. In his role as CEO, Mark is responsible for directing Accruent's overall vision, corporate strategy and operations.

Under his leadership, the company received two Dorsey Awards for excellence in customer service, was recognized as Software Developer of the Year in 2006 and was named to the Deloitte & Touche Technology Fast 50 list for the last seven consecutive years for achieving outstanding revenue growth.

Mark was recognized as a finalist for the Entrepreneur of the Year award, was named as one of the Top 30 People to Watch in commercial real estate, and was recognized as one of the Top 40 People Under 40 in retail. He is also a recipient of the BridgeGate20 Award.

Mark holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from Tulane University's School of Engineering.

accel-diagnostics.short_description: Accel Diagnostics is developing a lab-on-chip protein diagnostic platform that enables inexpensive, disposable, credit-card sized devices

founders.bio:
Alberto is a physicist turned biomedical engineer turned entrepreneur. Alberto founded Accel Diagnostics with the goal of enabling patients the chance to live a better life. Following an unconventional professional path, rejecting the conventional wisdom of what one can or cannot do, Alberto has led a team at Carnegie Mellon University through the development of the pScreen™ technology and now through the development and commercialization of the company’s first product.

Prior to his current role as CEO of AccelDx, Alberto was Research Assistant Professor at the University of Houston and Senior Research Scientist at the Biomedical Engineering Department at Carnegie Mellon University. Alberto has authored 30 peer-reviewed publications and holds 4 US patents. 

He holds a Ph.D. in Physics from the University of Houston and a MBA in entrepreneurship and finance from the Tepper School of Business at Carnegie Mellon University.

investors.bio:
Dave Mawhinney, Director, i6 Agile Innovation System, a collaboration between InnovationWorks and Carnegie Mellon University.

In addition to his i6 duties at InnovationWorks, Dave is the Managing Director of the Open Field Entrepreneurs Fund at Carnegie Mellon. He is also the Associate Director of the Donald H. Jones Center for Entrepreneurship at the Tepper School of Business at Carnegie Mellon.

Prior to joining InnovationWorks to lead the i6 Agile Innovation System, Dave was co-founder, Chairman and CEO of mSpoke, an internet content and advertising recommendation engine, was acquired in 2010 by LinkedIn, the world’s leading professional social networking site. In 2006, Morgan Stanley’s MSCI/Barra business unit acquired mSpoke’s first business line, a quantitative investment recommendation engine.

Prior to mSpoke, Dave was a General Partner of PNC Technology Investors. He co-founded three successful startup ventures before that, including Premier Health Exchange (acquired by Medibuy), Hawk Medical (acquired by McKesson), and Industry.Net (merged with AT&T Business Network to form Nets, Inc.).

Dave is also an active Board Member at MedSage Technologies (now NewCare Solutions LLC), EZ-FLO Injection Systems, CloudFab LLC, SnapRetail, and the Indiana University of Pennsylvania Alumni Association (ex-officio, Past President.). He is an Advisory Board Member to InnovationWork’s AlphaLab, Pittsburgh Equity Partners, and Carnegie Mellon University’s Project Olympus.

Dave has advised numerous start-up companies including 4Moms, Go-Op, Devotee, Black Locus, CareerImp, Crono, Skill-Life, GearHeadz and StockCastr. Dave was also a Executive-in-Residence at the Pittsburgh Life Sciences Greenhouse.

Mr. Mawhinney holds an MBA with Distinction from Carnegie Mellon University and a B. S. in Physics, Summa Cum Laude, from Indiana University of Pennsylvania.

founders.bio: Ashton is the founder of Acrinta.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Mr. Berry has nine years of private equity and four years of investment banking experience. Before joining WP Global, he was a principal for five years focused on co-investments at Abbott Capital Management LLC, a multi-billion private equity fund-of-funds manager. 

During this period, he managed a legacy $80 million preferred stock private equity portfolio, invested approximately $70 million of co-investment equity capital and assisted with numerous partnership investments. 

Previously, Mr. Berry was a junior principal at Grumman Hill Group, a small growth LBO firm, where he analyzed and performed due diligence for direct private equity investment opportunities in several industries. Mr. Berry started his career at Price Waterhouse Corporate Finance as an analyst in their Merger and Acquisitions advisory practice and also worked briefly in the healthcare investment banking practice of CIBC World Markets. 

Mr. Berry earned an M.B.A. from New York University and is a member of the Beta Gamma Sigma national honors society. He also earned a B.A. degree in Economics from Franklin and Marshall College.

David has broad experience in both private equity and mergers & acquisitions. David's primary focus has been on the healthcare, information technology and business services sectors. Prior to joining Petra, David was a General Partner at Richland Ventures, a venture capital fund with $340 million in assets under management. 

Earlier in his career, David led market development and acquisition activities for InformDx, a diagnostic laboratory company and THG Management Services, a managed healthcare company. 

David received a B.A. degree from Washington & Lee University.

David has Board level experience with many successful growth companies including: US Healthworks, Televox (sold to West Corp.), Appriss (sold to Bain Capital), Synhrgy (sold to Mercer), Nuvox Communications (sold to Windstream). He currently serves as a director on the boards of WellNow, Access Media 3, SpecialtyCare, New Century Hospice, Superior Global Solutions and Salveo Specialty Pharmacy.

Mr. Allen has 40 years of experience in the creation and management of start-up services businesses in the communications industry, having had key roles in building 5 enterprises valued at $1.0 billion or more. 

He is a Founder of Meritage and is actively involved on the Board of Meritage portfolio company Access Media 3. 

He was Executive Chairman of Meritage portfolio company Xspedius from 2000 to 2004, which was subsequently sold for $567 million. He served as Vice Chairman/CEO of Brooks Fiber Properties, which merged with MCI WorldCom in a $3.4 billion transaction, and was a co-founder/CFO of Cencom Cable Associates, which became the 15th largest cable TV company and was sold for $1.0 billion. Mr. Allen was also a founding investor in Verio, serving as a company director until its $6.4 billion acquisition by NTT.

founders.bio:
Scott has been the CEO since AM3's inception in January of 2007. AM3 is a rapidly growing triple-play provider of High Speed Internet, Television and Voice Services to multi-tenant residential properties in 20 states. Under Scott's leadership, AM3 has grown to over 700 properties and over 87,000 subscribers.

Scott has extensive experience helping build successful companies that deliver exceptional products. Most recently the Chief Operating Officer of Oak Brook Terrace, Ill.-based CIMCO Communications, Inc., Scott co-founded and developed Ovation Communications - a competitive local exchange carrier business offering facility-based local, long distance, and data services to medium and large sized businesses in the metropolitan areas of Chicago, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Milwaukee and Detroit. 

After much growth and success in just two years, Ovation Communications was sold to McLeod USA in 1999 for $402 million. After the sale, Scott served as a Senior Vice President of Products and Development for McLeod USA, developing the company's still-strong presence in the Midwest.

Prior to his success with Ovation, Scott worked with MFS Communications, one of the pioneers of the telecommunications revolution, where he held various managerial positions, worked and lived in London assisting with the companies' U.K. launch, and helped develop MFS' entry strategy into Canada. Scott has been actively involved in fund raising activities which has produced $100m debt financing and $100m of equity. 

Scott also served as an investor and board member of Advocate Networks, an Atlanta-based communication services firm, and held key executive positions as President and Chief Operating Officer of Dantis, a Chicago-based web hosting and managed services firm.

investors.bio: ship it

founders.bio:
Javier Soltero is CEO & Co-Founder of Acompli.  

Prior to starting Acompli, Javier was at VMware where he was CTO of SaaS & Application Services.  He was responsible for driving advanced development and strategy for application level cloud services, bringing more than 15 years of experience in designing and developing infrastructure management technologies. Javier joined VMware after the acquisition of SpringSource in 2009. Three months prior, SpringSource had acquired Soltero’s Hyperic, the leader in large scale web infrastructure management software, where he was the co-founder and CEO. 

Prior to starting Hyperic, Javier held chief architect and senior engineering positions at a number of enterprise software and consumer internet companies including Netscape, where he was responsible for early internet messaging, application servers and e-commerce technologies. Throughout his career, Javier has been actively involved in various open source communities as both user and contributor to projects like JBoss and Apache Tomcat. He is also an active advisor to a number of open source and SaaS startups. Javier is originally from San Juan, Puerto Rico and received his bachelor of science degree in information systems and industrial management from Carnegie Mellon University.

Kevin Henrikson is currently leading engineering for [Acompli](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/acompli-inc) in San Francisco. Previously he was an Entrepreneur-in-Residence for [Redpoint Ventures](http://www.crunchbase.com/financial-organization/redpoint-ventures), a venture capital firm for early stage technology companies. 

Kevin graduated from UCLA (BS Engineering) in 2000. His early career included operations and technical leadership roles for Federal Express, iSearch (SAAS startup), and Openwave Systems, a mobile Internet software solutions company.

In 2005 he joined [Zimbra](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/zimbra), an enterprise collaboration and messaging startup and quickly advanced to Director of Engineering, building and managing a team to develop enterprise and mobility technologies. In 2007 Zimbra was acquired by [Yahoo!](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/yahoo) for $350M.

In 2010 he continued as a Senior Director of Engineering after Zimbra was re-acquired by [VMWare](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/vmware), directing Zimbra's engineering and development roadmap planning and execution, including potential company acquisitions. His achievements include steering the successful transition following VMware’s acquisition and championing new quality and agile development processes that reduced bugs in the field, improved schedule predictability, and enabled a more fluid development process. He holds a published patent and a filed patent in conjunction with his work at Zimbra.

Kevin is also the co-founder and former CTO of [Alpha Brand Media](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/alpha-brand-media), a digital media publishing company that owns and operates a large portfolio of blogs and websites reaching millions of visitors every month, and specializes in social media and content marketing. He designed the server architecture for ABM and managed all technical resources in support of a network of hundreds of sites. Today he advises on overall strategy and technology.

As an [angel investor](https://angel.co/kevinhenrikson), he enjoys working with ambitious entrepreneurs on disruptive solutions in mobile, enterprise SaaS and the consumer internet.

JJ Zhuang is Co-Founder and CTO of Acompli, Inc. He has more than a decade of hands-on experience building large-scale software systems for enterprises and service providers. He built and launched multiple products from scratch, leading teams small to large. Prior to Acompli JJ was Chief Architect of the Horizon Workspace business unit at VMware where he heads a technical team of 100+ engineers. Before that he was Chief Architect of Zimbra, an open source email platform that counts 55 million commercial mailboxes world-wide.

investors.bio:
Rob is a social entrepreneur-turned tech CEO, and is well-versed in both spaces.
His specialty is teaching entrepreneurs "how to think like a social entrepreneur." 

Startup 6: The Mobile Majority, formerly known as PaeDae (AdTech)
Mission: Bringing premium brand advertising to mobile
Status: Growing Exponentially
Funding: Investor Backed, $21 million 

Startup 5: BULX, (Flash Sales E-commerce for Durable Goods)
Action & Result: Signed exclusive online distribution agreement with Angie’s List (Nasdaq: ANGI), in less than 1 year BULX became the worlds first & largest private sales company for home improvement products. It was acquired by DealYard.com in 2011
Funding: Bootstrapped
Lesson: The right team is critical

Startup 4: Boundaryless Brands, (Enterprise E-commerce, Logistics, and Marketing Technology Platform)
Action & Result: Built e-commerce and marketing technology for medium sized ($20MM to $120MM) distributors of durable goods. Acquired in 2011
Funding: Bootstrapped, Lesson: Focus on the opportunity, not on control

Startup 3: SpeakerSite (Online Marketplace of Public Speakers)
Action & Result: Large adoption, little revenue, three years of 'ramen profitability', ceased operation
Funding: Bootstrapped
Lesson: Take on a big market with a burning problem, focus on one company at a time

Startup 2.: B.A. Mensch Consulting (Digital Marketing and Technology Consulting)
Action & Result: Scaled to seven figure revenue, evolved into next three ventures
Funding: Bootstrapped
Lesson: Be a good person, treat people right

Startup 1: Road of Life | The Keren Emrich Foundation (Nonprofit, Social Enterprise)
Action & Result: Sold car and stocks, built the first online health curriculum in wiki format, scaled to $70M in distribution to over 250,000 children internationally
Funding: Stage 1, Bootstrapped; Stage 2, Grew to Government, Corporate, Foundation Grants & Major Gifts
Lesson: Meaning trumps everything, do something that matters

founders.bio: Glen Moriarty, Founder and CEO, is a psychologist passionate about the Internet’s power to help people lead better lives. He has been involved in a number of services and organizations that support people in need. 7 Cups of Tea is his most recent endeavor; marrying his background in psychology with his love for technology. Glen lives with his wife, Nicole, and their four children, Colin, Madeliene, Avery, and London.

investors.bio:
Barry Nalebuff is Chairman of the Board and Co-founder of Honest Tea, as well as the Milton Steinbach Professor of Economics and Management at Yale School of Management.

An expert on game theory, Barry has written extensively on its application to business strategy. He is the co-author of Thinking Strategically: The Competitive Edge in Business, Politics, and Everyday Life, the first popular book on game theory, and one used in classrooms worldwide. In his second book, Co-opetition, Nalebuff applies game theory to business strategy, with an emphasis on creating and capturing value. Problem solving and ingenuity is the topic of his third book Why Not? How to Use Everyday Ingenuity to Solve Problems Big and Small and his most recent book is entitled The Art of Strategy.

A graduate of MIT, a Rhodes Scholar, and Junior Fellow at the Harvard Society of Fellows, Nalebuff earned his doctorate at Oxford University.

academic-earth.short_description: Academic Earth offers a comprehensive collection of online courses from universities such as Harvard, Yale, Stanford, and MIT.

founders.bio:
In 2008, Richard Ludlow founded Academic Earth, a platform for full video courses from leading universities. Academic Earth was acquired in 2011 by Ampush Media.

Richard holds a BA and MA in Economics from Yale University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Liam Pisano joined Hercules Technology Growth Capital in 2010. Pisano focuses on investments in later stage venture and lower middle market opportunities in the technology, education and health care sectors. Prior to joining Hercules, Pisano was a co-founder of Academic Earth; a Yale University funded start-up focused on providing lead generation services to the education community.  Pisano worked at Patriot Capital from 2007 to 2009, where he focused on senior and mezzanine loans to companies in the business services and health care industries.

 Pisano began his career in 2000 with Spectrum Equity Investors, where he performed due diligence on private equity investments in the technology, communications and media sectors. Pisano received his B.A in Political Science from Williams College, and his M.B.A from the Yale School of Management.

 He is a 10-year member of the Big Brothers Association of Massachusetts and co-founder of the William Gaines Foundation, a non-profit organization serving underprivileged, overachieving inner city high school students

accuvant.short_description: Accuvant is the leading provider of information security services and solutions serving enterprise-class organizations across North America.

founders.bio:
Being able to provide clear insight into navigating the complex information security landscape is not just a priority for Dan Burns, it’s what sets the company apart from its competitors. Dan’s philosophy is to focus on building long-term relationships with clients, working with them to simplify their lives and become a trusted information security partner rather than a reseller or outside consultant. Needless to say, Dan has been successful and his efforts have greatly contributed to the company's 70x growth since 2002.

Prior to co-founding Accuvant, Dan was a regional vice president of sales for OneSecure (acquired by Netscreen), regional vice president of sales for Exault (acquired by VeriSign) and a sales leader for several other security companies.

accountnow.short_description: AccountNow is a financial services company offering MasterCard and Visa prepaid accounts for people who have been turned away by banks.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Joanna Rees is running for Mayor of San Francisco in the 2011 election.

With a beginning investment of $50,000 cobbled together from savings and personal debt, Joanna formed Venture Strategy Group together with a partner (later renamed VSP Capital). Within four years, they built a $200 million fund.

Joanna's business was based simply on identifying smart entrepreneurs with great ideas and making them happen. Investing in and advising early-stage best-of-breed innovative ideas, VSP helped build more than 60 Bay Area companies, moving innovative concepts from the drawing board, through the research, planning, and financing stages, and establishing dozens of solid, sustainable companies with long-term value. Over fourteen years, VSP weathered the dot.com collapse and helped start firms in a diverse range of industries including technology, retailing, consumer products, wireless networking, cognitive learning software, and financial services for the unbanked. VSP companies have created thousands of jobs across the Bay Area.

via: [JoinJoanna.com](http://www.joinjoanna.com)

Joanna Rees is Chief Fonera of FON USA and president of the US Advisory Board. Joanna began her career at DMB&B and is the founder of VSP Capital. She currently serves on the Board of Directors of Posit Science, Sabrix, AccountNow, Danger, QuinStreet, The Threshold Group and the Board of Directors of the NVCA. 

via: [FON](http://www.fon.com/en/info/whosBehind)

Don Dixon is a Managing Director of Trident Capital and co-founded the firm in 1993. At Trident, he focuses on investments in IT Security, Business Services, Financial Payments, and Enterprise Software. 

He brings his expertise, experience and network to each of his portfolio companies and has helped many to become industry leaders, including Qualys, Merchant e-Solutions, Bytemobile and CSG Systems.

Currently, Don serves as a director of Qualys (QLYS), 2Checkout, AccountNow, Advanced Payment Solutions, Amprius, eGistics, Infotrieve, Neohapsis, Odyssey Logistics, RoyaltyShare, SivaPower, Tiandi Energy and XRS Corporation (XRSC). 

He is also on the investment committee of Mustang Ventures, an affiliated China fund of Trident Capital Fund VI. Recently, AlwaysOn recognized Don’s investment success on its “Venture Capital 100” list.

Don’s past directorships include Affiliated Computer Services (ACS), Anasazi Inc. (acquired by Pegasus Solutions), Bank of America Merchant Services (BPI), BlueStar Solutions (acquired by ACS), ByteMobile (acquired by Citrix), CSG Systems (CSGS), Epicor Software Corporation (EPIC), Epoch Partners (acquired by Goldman Sachs), Evolving Systems (EVOL), InfoUSA (IUSA), Merchant e-Solutions (acquired by Cielo), Pegasus Systems (PEGS), Signio (acquired by Verisign), Sygate Technologies (acquired by Symantec) and Unison Software (acquired by IBM).

founders.bio:
Sara is responsible for the mechanical design and development of the uBox. She also manages the marketing and business analysis aspects. 

Sara has prior entrepreneurial product design experience with MolySym and has independently contracted with companies such as Raytheon and Sunpower. She also has several patents pending for independent inventions. 

Sara is passionate about using her design experience help people, having previously worked on a non-invasive glucose meter and innovative mobility devices. She has her Master's in Mechanical Engineering from MIT and B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from UC Berkeley.

'Greddy' devised the overall architecture of the uBox system, including designing the electronics and firmware of the uBox and uKey. 

Greddy holds past EE design experience from working for MolySym as well as sensing and robotics from the Biomechatronics Group at the MIT Media Lab. 

He also has relevant developing-world experience from Developing World Prosthetics, a non-profit he co-founded to improve low-cost rehabilitation devices. 

Greddy received a Master's in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS), as well as B.S. degrees in Mathematics and EECS from MIT.

700bike.short_description: 700BIKE is an Internet company to promote bicycle culture.

founders.bio:
Xiangdong Zhang is the co-founder and President of Sungy Mobile Limited, a mobile app and mobile platform development firm offering the 'GO' series products and platform.  

Zhang previously served in various capacities at Shanda Interactive, serving as Senior Vice President from June 2006 to April 2008. Zhang also served as Vice President from July 2005 to June 2006 and as Director of its product management center from 2001 to July 2005. 

In 2004 Zhang co-founded 3G protal and Go Desktop with Yuqiang Deng. 

Prior to joining Shanda Interactive, Zhang served as the Editor-in-Chief of the game channel at China.com from 1999 to 2001. Zhang started his career as a journalist working for a weekly magazine. 

Zhang holds a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from Dalian Institute of Light Industry and obtained an MBA from Fudan University.

founders.bio:
Kurt Hanson is the founder and CEO of AccuRadio, a radio and music streaming application.


He is also the publisher of RAIN: Radio And Internet Newsletter, a web-based newsletter for the fast-growing field of internet radio.


As a popular keynote speaker, he has given his “State of the Industry Address” speech on the future of radio at conferences around the world, and is quoted regularly by top news sources including the Wall Street Journal, New York Times, USA Today, Chicago Tribune, The Globe and Mail, and cable channels CNN, and CNBC.


Hanson developed his reputation and expertise within the radio industry as the founder and CEO of Strategic Media Research (1980-2000), a market research firm respected throughout the radio industry for its music research program and its ratings product, which he built into a $10 million business.  In high school, college, and throughout graduate school, Hanson worked at various major radio stations, including WOKY, WLS, WDAI, and WLUP.


He holds a B.A. and an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago.

Tom is the CEO of Acquia.

Previously Tom was the CEO of Systinet, sold to Mercury Interactive in 2006.  Tom left Mercury at the time of the HP acquisition in 2007.  Tom moved to Boston, Massachusetts in 2004.  Prior to that, he lived with his family in Sydney, Australia, where he had been the EVP International for webMethods and the President Asia-Pacific & Japan for Baan.

He is/has been a board member and advisor for several companies, including Quickcomm Software (sold to Vodafone), iTKO (sold to CA), TaskRabbit, Akiban, ExpenseCloud and OfferPop.

Tom was born and raised in Mondovi, Wisconsin and attended the University of Wisconsin-Madison. He has an honors degree in electrical and computer engineering.  Tom has spent 14 years of his career living outside of the USA and remains passionate about travel, food, wine, photography and skiing/snowboarding.  He lives in Prides Crossing, Massachusetts with his wife and two sons.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Thomas F. Bogan has served as a director of the Company since January 2003 and as chairperson of the Board of Directors since May 2005. Mr. Bogan also serves as a member of the Board of Directors of Parametric Technology Corporation, a publicly-traded company that develops, markets and supports product development software solutions. Since 2004, Mr. Bogan has been a Partner at Greylock Partners, a venture capital firm.Mr. Bogan is Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and a member of the Compensation and Strategy Committees.
The Board of Directors has determined that Mr. Bogan is “independent” within the meaning of the Company’s director independence standards and the director independence standards of The Nasdaq Stock Market, LLC.

John joined Sigma in 1996. With over 20 years of experience as an entrepreneur, a business unit manager, and an investor, John uses motivation, enthusiasm, and his own technology and operational expertise to support Sigma’s portfolio companies. 

Throughout his career, he has held executive management positions, created new business units and departments, and sponsored new projects at some of the industry’s most successful technology companies.

Prior to Sigma, John was the President & CEO of Vermeer Technologies, Inc., the developers of FrontPage, the leading Web authoring tool. Vermeer was acquired by Microsoft, providing Sigma and the other venture investors a very successful return. 

Previously, he was an early principal at SQL Solutions, where he created and led an engineering organization chartered to build heterogeneous database tools. 

Following an acquisition of SQL Solutions by Sybase, he took responsibility for the new Systems Management Product unit, which he grew to $55 million in sales in 30 months. 

Early in his career, John was recruited to Honeywell, where he worked on a variety of engineering projects in the areas of communications, operating systems, and unix co-processor design.

John is a graduate of Tufts (BSE in Engineering Science and Mathematics) and Worcester Polytechnic University (MS in Computer Science).

Chetan Puttagunta joined NEA in 2011 and focuses on Big Data, infrastructure software, and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications. Prior to joining NEA, Chetan was with H.I.G. Capital’s Leveraged Buyout Group, where he was involved in financing and executing new investment opportunities as well as actively managing portfolio companies. Prior to H.I.G., Chetan was a Technology Investment Banker with Houlihan Lokey where he advised clients on over $6 billion of strategic transactions. Chetan earned his bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University. While at Stanford, he was involved in algorithm research at Stanford's STARlab.

Ric Fulop joined North Bridge as a General Partner following a fifteen-year career as an entrepreneur that spanned hands-on experience from seed to IPO. He is the founder of six technology companies in multiple sectors (software, internet, semiconductors, wireless communications and energy storage) including A123Systems, Boston's largest IPO in the past decade.

North Bridge is a leading technology investor with over $4B under management having backed premier technology companies like Actifio, Acquia, Couchbase, Dyn, DemandWare (NASDAQ:DWRE), Onshape, ProtoLabs (NASDAQ:PRLB) and Quora.

At North Bridge Ric led the Series A rounds in Onshape, MarkForged, Salsify, Gridco Systems and Dyn as well as the Series B for Disqus.  Ric leads the North Bridge software and 3D investing practices.  North Bridge was the original Series A investor in several of the companies that have changed the 3D and CAD/CAM landscape including SolidWorks (acq. by Dassault Systemes), ProtoLabs (NASDAQ: PRLB), SpaceClaim (acq. by Ansys) and Revit (acq. by Autodesk).

Most recently, in 2001, he founded A123 Systems, a North Bridge investment, to commercialize technology developed at the Material Sciences and Engineering Department of MIT. At his departure the company had a public market capitalization of $1.5 billion, 1,800 employees with production facilities around the world and had shipped over $300 million in state-of-the-art energy storage systems.

Ric is a former Board Member of the Electric Drive Transportation Association, is an avid pilot and holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School where he was a Sloan Fellow.

Specialties: 3D Printing, 3D Modeling and CAD, Energy Storage, Infrastructure Software

founders.bio: Jay Batson an angel investor and full-time mentor in the Boston infotech ecosystem. Previously, he was the Co-Founder and CEO of [Acquia](/company/acquia).  Acquia is the second technology company Jay has been involved with, and is also his second commercial open-source effort.  He previously was founder & CEO of Pingtel, which was acquired by Bluesocket in 2007.

Dries Buytaert is the founder of Drupal, an open source web publishing platform and a co-founder of Drupal Association, a non-profit organization that supports Drupal;  Acquia, a venture-backed software company that offers products and services for Drupal; and Mollom,  a web service. He is also the CTO of Aquia, president of Drupal Association, and project lead of Drupal.


Buytaert was chosen as the CTO of the Year by Massachusetts Technology Leadership Council (MassTLC) in 2014, DataNews ICT Personality of the Year in 2014, Entrepreneur of the Year by Ernst & Young for New England in 2012, and CIO of the Year by Boston Business Journal and Mass High Tech in 2012. He was also included on Business Insider’s list of top 50 most powerful people in enterprise technology, BusinessWeek’s list of top 30-and-under innovators of 2008, MIT TR’s list of Young Innovators of 2008, MindTouch’s list of top 5 influential Open Source executives of 2009. Acquia was elected as one of the Top 100 Most Promising Companies by Forbes in 2011 and the fastest growing private software company in the United States by Inc in 2012.


Dries Buytaert holds a PhD in computer science and engineering from Ghent University and an MSc in computer science from University of Antwerp.

After finishing computer science studies at the Faculty of Timisoara, Cornianu worked for three years in Alcatel-Lucent. In 2008, he decided to start his own company together with Tudor Bastea, with whom he had already developed a number of other online projects.

Currently, Cornianu is in charge of all domains related to business administration at 123ContactForm, such as financials, marketing, and human resources.

Tudor Bastea is a co-founder of 123ContactForm, a SaaS-based web platform.

Bastea completed his computer science studies at the Faculty of Timisoara and joined a multinational company, where he worked for two and half years.

In 2008, Bastea decided to start his own company together with Florin Cornianu, with whom he had already developed a number of other online projects.

Bastea manages the development team at 123ContactForm and supervises the development and integration of new features in the platform.

board_members_and_advisors.bio:
Chad Waite joined OVP Venture Partners in 1987 and focuses on investments in the digital biology, and network security sectors. His investments include 4thPass, Accelerator, Adapx, Airgo Networks, Boston Beer, Cardima, CellPro, Complete Genomics, Corixa, Filenet, GenoLogics, Limerick BioPharma, Loudeye Technologies, NanoString, Napera Networks, ProTools, Quantum Medical, Raytel Medical, Returns Online, Rosetta Inpharmatics, SafeHarbor, Saros, Seattle Genetics, SignalSoft, Syntellect, Vantos, Verdezyne, Verity, and WatchGuard. 

He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Accelerator, Adapx, Aggregate Knowledge, NanoString, Symform, Verdezyne and The W Fund, and is a Board Observer to Talyst.

Prior to joining OVP, Chad was a General Partner at Hambrecht & Quist Venture Partners where he focused on investments in IT and life sciences. 

Prior to H&Q, he was in marketing and sales management at Cobe Laboratories, Inc. in its cardiovascular medical products division.

Chad received his BA in History from Kenyon College and his MBA from Harvard Business School. 

He is a Trustee at Kenyon College and has also served as a board member of the NVCA. He is the proud father of three grown children, is an avid cyclist and snowboarder, and loves fine wine.

Joel S. Marcus, J.D., C.P.A. – Chairman/Chief Executive Officer, Founder and Director of Alexandria Real Estate Equities, Inc., a $6.1 billion total market capital NYSE company with a stellar public track record is the pre-eminent real estate investment trust focused principally on the ownership, operation, management, redevelopment, selective development and acquisition of properties containing office/laboratory space, the Labspace® niche which Alexandria pioneered. Such properties are designed and improved for lease primarily to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, life science research, product, service, defense, educational and translational research entities, as well as related government agencies. 

Mr. Marcus has extensive expertise, experience and contacts in the life sciences and real estate industries. He is highly experienced in real estate, finance and capital market matters, venture capital and mergers/acquisitions. Mr. Marcus has been involved with the formation, financing and operations of companies ranging in size from multi-billion dollar conglomerates to start-ups. 

Mr. Marcus won the 1999 Ernst & Young “Entrepreneur of the Year” Award: Los Angeles – Real Estate. The New York Academy of Sciences Economic Development for Science Award recipient for leadership in support of New York City as a center of scientific excellence. Mr. Marcus is nationally recognized for his experience and expertise in strategic partnering and was one of the original architects of the Kirin-Amgen joint venture. This joint venture owns the rights and financed the development of erythropoietin and granulocyte colony stimulating factor, the two leading genetically engineered pharmaceutical producers. 

Mr. Marcus was one of the original architects and founders of The Accelerator(SM) Seattle, Washington, and The New York City Orthopedics Technologies Venture, New York, New York. He received his undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of California, Los Angeles.

investors.bio:
Jonathan is a senior adviser to Coady Diemar Partners. Previously, he was a principal in the private equity firm, Leeds Weld. 

Before that, he served as a member of Viacom's Executive Committee and, from 1991 to 2002, led Simon & Schuster, first as President and COO, then Chairman and CEO. 

Under his leadership, Simon & Schuster made numerous acquisitions and became one of the world's largest publishers of books and instructional, training and professional reference materials.

As Chegg’s Chief Learning Officer, Nathan is responsible for student achievement, overseeing all aspects of Chegg’s self-directed learning tools, which includes content development and publisher relations. Nathan has dedicated his career to putting students first and representing their interests within the world of educational publishing, having served at Bowker, Pearson, and Jones & Bartlett prior to joining Chegg. Nathan attended Elon University in North Carolina, receiving his BA in History and English and continued his education at Stevens Institute of Technology, in New Jersey. In his spare time, Nathan enjoys traveling and tearing up the outdoor trails.​

David received his BS Engineering degree from UC Berkeley and his MS Management & Engineering degree from Stanford University.
